SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@78.description: Reference system for the area of interest. It can be 1) the Spatial Reference System Identifier (SRID), 2) the authority name (e.g. EPSG) with the SRID or 3) the description of the spatial reference system details (e.g. [https://spatialreference.org/]). If just the SRID is given and the software can not find the reference system try options 2 or 3.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@78.label: spatial reference system

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Name of the country for the analysis. Check the available countries and regions here: https://www.naturalearthdata.com/downloads/10m-cultural-vectors/
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: country

SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@77.description:
Source of the expert range map for the species. The options are:
Map of Life (MOL), International union for conservation of nature (IUCN) and range maps from the Ministère de l’Environnement du Québec (QC).
SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@77.label: source of expert range map

SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@76.description: Scientific name of the species. Multiple species names can be specified, separated with a comma.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@76.label: species

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Raster with expected area for the species if choosing option "Raster"
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: range map (raster)

SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.description: Year where the analysis should start. Starts in 2000, check the time interval available for the Global Forest Watch data at https://stac.geobon.org/collections/gfw-lossyear.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.label: initial time

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Path to the study area file if you choosing option "User defined" for study area option. This file should be a polygon with a .gpkg extension or .shp (in this case do not foget to add the projection file to the folder).
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: study area

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Choose the source for the study area either if it should be at a country level and downloaded according to the 'country_code', at region level according to 'region' or a user defined polygon with the borders of the study area.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: study area option

SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.description: Year where the analysis should end (it should be later than Initial time). It should be inside the time interval for the Global Forest Watch data at https://stac.geobon.org/collections/gfw-lossyear.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.label: final time

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Size of the buffer around the study area. If it is not defined it will be estimated as half of the total width of the study area.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: buffer for study area

SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.description: Maximum tree cover percentage required for each species, based on suitable habitat of the species. Acts as a filter for the Global Forest Watch Data. If not available, use Map of Life Values (e.g. [https://mol.org/species/range/Myrmecophaga-tridactyla]). For multiple species, input in the same order as input in species and separate with a comma.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.label: max forest

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Elevation buffer in meters to add (or substract) to the reported species elevation range. Default is zero. Positive values will increase the range in that value in meters and negative values will reduce the range in that value.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: elevation buffer

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: If 'yes' an elevation filter using IUCN information is applied, if 'no' the range map is taken as the area of habitat.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: filter by elevation

SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.description: Temporal resolution for analysis given in number of years. To get values for the end year, time step should fit evenly into the given analysis range.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.label: time step

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: Select type of range map according to the type of the source file: 1) polygon, 2) raster, 3) an intersection between the raster and polygon files.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: type of range map

SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.description: Minimum tree cover percentage required for each species, based on suitable habitat of the species. Acts as a filter for the Global Forest Watch Data. If not available, use Map of Life Values (e.g. [https://mol.org/species/range/Myrmecophaga-tridactyla]). For multiple species, input in the same order as input in species and separate with a comma.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.label: min forest

SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.description: For cases when a more specific administrative boundary (than the country level) is required, a region name can be used. Check the available countries and regions here: https://www.naturalearthdata.com/downloads/10m-cultural-vectors/
SHI_pipeline.json@34|data>getAreaOfHabit.label: region

SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@79.description: Spatial resolution (in meters) for the output of the analysis.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|pipeline@79.label: output spatial resolution

SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.description: A TSV (Tab Separated Values) file containing Area Score, Connectivity Score and SHS by time step for each species. Percentage of change, 100% being equal to the reference year.
SHI_pipeline.json@34|SHI>habitatChange_G.label: SHS table
